availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Commodore P. Oldham (Hopkins Co. wagoner, farmer, pvt. 17th Ky Cav.)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, wagoner and soldier. Kentucky native. Wagoner in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1863. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1864. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 3, 1865 to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Hopkins County, KY, December 1863, p. 144 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 405.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0140.
Find A Grave, "Commodore Oldham (1841-1869)," Memorial #108663791, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/108663791 (accessed October 29, 2020).
